node.title: Oh, to Be Mentored by Virgil Abloh
node.description: The designer made it his mission to foster the talents of young creators.

node.title: Every Object Was a Canvas
node.description: Virgil Abloh expanded the idea of what a collaboration could be.

node.title: Texts From Virgil
node.description: After his death, Virgil Abloh’s friends and colleagues shared some of the kind, curious and relentlessly optimistic DMs the designer was known to send. “2021 is a picture for us all to urgently paint.”

node.title: Omicron Could Knock a Fragile Economic Recovery Off Track
node.description: The latest zigzag in the pandemic has already curtailed travel, but its broader impact on growth and inflation isn’t likely to be known for several weeks.

node.title: ‘Call Me Dog Tag Man’: Pacific Island Is Full of War Relics and Human Remains
node.description: More than 75 years after the Battle of Biak ended, collectors are still finding remnants of the fight, and U.S. authorities are hoping to bring closure to families of soldiers still missing.

node.title: Did Anyone Win the Powerball Jackpot on 12/1/21? Numbers and Results
node.description: A dozen lucky ticket holders each won at least $50,000, but did anyone bag the top prize last night?

node.title: The father of missing Belgian backpacker Theo Hayez storms out of coronial inquest
node.description: The father of missing Belgian backpacker Theo Hayez has stormed out of a coronial inquest in Byron Bay, as security guards give evidence about evicting his son.

node.title: Police and iwi to set up Northland checkpoints
node.description: Police and iwi will set up checkpoints between Auckland and Northland once the border reopens around New Zealand's biggest city later this month.

node.title: The great annual Hunua Ranges kōkako nest survey is underway
node.description: With breeding season in full swing, a team of conservationists and rangers is keeping a close eye on how many chicks are hatching.

node.title: US white supremacists targeting under-vaxxed Aboriginal communities, WA Premier says
node.description: Mark McGowan says American hate groups are specifically targeting remote Aboriginal communities by spreading misinformation about COVID-19 vaccinations.

node.title: Black Caps up for an upset
node.description: The Black Caps are confident they can pull off an upset win against hosts India in the second and final test in Mumbai to complete a historic series victory.

node.title: Whanganui mayor backs iwi's plea for holidaymakers to steer clear of region
node.description: The mayor of Whanganui is supporting an iwi leader's call for holidaymakers to steer clear of the region this summer.

node.title: Rhythm and Vines postpone festival until Easter 2022
node.description: Festival organisers say the decision was made in consultation with iwi, the DHB and politicians.

node.title: Councils split on requiring Covid-19 vaccine pass
node.description: Councils around the country are applying the new traffic light rules differently when it comes to people using pools and libraries.

node.title: Spacewalk approved after debris scare prompted delay
node.description: After assessing possibly threatening space debris, NASA cleared two astronauts to press ahead with a spacewalk.

node.title: 'You can't hate yourself into being better': The misconception around feeling guilt versus shame
node.description: Research professor Brené Brown has spent a large part of her career looking at shame, which she says has now become an epidemic in society. So how can we better deal with our feelings?

node.title: NSW man's alleged $5,000 rampage in Tasmanian COVID quarantine hotel
node.description: A New South Wales man who flew into Tasmania then allegedly refused to leave and caused $5,000 worth of damage to his hotel quarantine room is sent packing by police.

node.title: 'Such a mess' - IT teams work overnight to fix immigration glitch
node.description: Immigration advisers have described the first day of the country's new residence scheme as a shambles.

node.title: Éric Zemmour Is Opening a New Chapter in France’s Long Racist History
node.description: It doesn’t take much to see the roots of his ideology. The irony is that this time, its proponent is Jewish.

node.title: Why Peng Shuai Has China’s Leaders Spooked
node.description: Ms. Peng’s celebrity certainly has driven interest in her case. But her allegations also are groundbreaking.

node.title: Dad Charged With Felony Neglect For Death of 2-Year-Old Girl Found in River's Debris Field
node.description: Jeremy Sweet was also charged with unlawful possession of a syringe and being a habitual offender, Bartholomew County Sheriff Matthew Myers said.

node.title: Child confirmed as NSW's seventh Omicron COVID-19 case, more exposure sites named
node.description: A Sydney Woolworths is among a number of venues visited by a child who is NSW's seventh confirmed case of the Omicron COVID-19 variant.

node.title: About 1400 school teachers refuse Covid-19 vaccination
node.description: Education Ministry figures indicate just 2.4 percent of school teachers have refused the Covid vaccination.

node.title: FCC's 'Equal Time' Rules Prompt Stations to Take The 'Dr. Oz Show' Off The Air
node.description: TV stations that air in and around Pennsylvania announced Wednesday they would stop airing Dr. Oz's show in an effort to avoid violating the campaign rule.

node.title: In Surprising Move, Canada Rules Boeing Out of Finalists to Build New Fighter Planes
node.description: The finalists, Lockheed Martin's F-35 stealth fighter and Saab's Gripen, surprised many as American aerospace giant Boeing's Super Hornet was left out.

node.title: If you think this is rats jumping off a sinking political ship, think again
node.description: The departure of some of the nation's most high-profile Liberal politicians on the eve on an election easily lends itself to the suggestion of rats fleeing a sinking ship. But as the last poll showed, it's not over until the votes are cast, writes political correspondent Brett Worthington.

node.title: Jacuzzi acquires NZ spa pool company Vortex
node.description: The Nelson-based company, the world's largest dedicated spa retailer, been acquired by US brand Jacuzzi.

node.title: Widow of man paralysed on 69th birthday says NDIS threshold has 'got to be fixed'
node.description: Both major parties have been accused of "shameful" inaction over the NDIS age cut-off. Now, advocates are fighting to make it a federal election issue.

node.title: Thunderstorm asthma warning for Melbourne and surrounds as more storms to lash the city
node.description: Melburnians are once again being told to batten down the hatches while remaining on high alert for thunderstorm asthma conditions, with forecast high pollen levels and strong winds sparking warnings.

node.title: PM accuses Labor of 'disgraceful slur' over Home Affairs contracts awarded to two close friends
node.description: Scott Morrison hits back at any suggestion he had a role in the Home Affairs Department awarding an almost $80,000 contract to a company run by two of his closest friends.
